question: Which of the following is India's first green energy corridor project facilitated with ultra high-voltage direct current (UHVDC) link over the span of 1800km?
explanation: Green Energy Corridor project is being implemented by eight renewable-rich states viz. Tamil Nadu, Rajasthan, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Maharashtra, Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh and Madhya Pradesh. The project aims at Intra-State Transmission System. India’s first green energy corridor project is an 800 kilovolt (kV) ultra high-voltage direct current (UHVDC) link over 1,800km is being laid in the Raigarh-Pugalur section thereby connecting Maharashtra and Tamil Nadu. The project by state-run Power Grid Corporation of India (PGCIL) is being executed by ABB Group in partnership with Bharat Heavy Electricals Limited (BHEL).
